reviewTitle: Nice update with one bad engineering choice
reviewDescription: My previous iPad was air-2 which I had for 8 years and besides severely shortned battery life and slow browser on heavy pages it was still going strong. So with that retrospective I bought rather cheap basic model. Speed, picture, camera and microphone (I do a lot of video chat) is excellent, battery life is acceptable, noticeably better speakers (comparing to old air 2). 4 points because of one bad decision apple engineers made - power button is fingerprint id. Which works about half the time from first press, half the time from second press and so on. Just plain bad design (smaller area of scanner, button collects dirt). Another thing I thing they wrong is not providing wireless charging, but that’s somewhat expected of nowadays apple…
The iPad is in good quality the box that came in was a little questionable but overall the iPad seems to be working no glitches but I would have to keep you posted because I just opened it.

reviewTitle: It will shut down on its own, and will not turn on, unless you have a way to plug it in.
reviewDescription: It works wonderful! Till it gets down till about 48% charge and then it will just shut off. Have to plug it back in for a minute or two and then it will turn back on.

reviewTitle: My third iPad and a considerable step up
reviewDescription: If this iPad were about $100 cheaper I would eulogize it. I would say the move to usb-c is very welcome. I would say the speed is great and the storage (256GB) more than adequate for most uses. But as it is, I am annoyed at paying $150 for what amounts to a tiny upgrade in memory. Especially considering I can already get a 2TB NVMe drive for less money. But Apple is Apple.What is ridiculous is the lack of provision for the Gen 1 Apple Pencil. One of the big features of this iPad is support for a pencil. You would think they'd provide a charging port for the pencil (which uses Apples proprietary plug/socket arrangement). But no. Nothing, nada.I had no problems taping the 3 months of Apple TV Plus, so kudos for that one! Yes, I will probably end up as a subscriber for content differentiators such as Slow Horses and Foundation. So a good marketing move from Apple!I am disappointed the screen still has a very significant bezel. I expect the next generation will reduce or eliminate this gaping blackness around the screen. So in other words make it more like an iPhone. But it's still way better than the last generation iPad Mini!In terms of speed and RAM? Well, definitely a step up, but I would hoped to see the M1 chip by now. I would also like to see far more investment in 3D scanning (photogrammetry) but I guess you'll need to step up to Pro and then fork out money for a usable application.Overall the iPad 10th gen feels a bit dated. Lacking in distinguishing features.  Wifi 6 and pencil support is so-so in terms of excitement. Even the max storage is looking extremely stingy at only 256GB. But overall I consider it a good purchase for those of us who are locked in to Apples seductive interoperability and consistent user experience. I certainly would not choose to go back to an Android tablet!

Well, USB-C charging port is different, had to get a USB to USB-C cable for the family charging station. (it did come with its own charger) The home button moved to the top-right edge and yes, this is where you record your finger print.  Works great.  It works with the First-Gen iPencil, not the 2nd Gen.
Was difficult to set up as there were no instructions. Had a friend help me with set up, but once working was fun to use.
I love this ipad. However I expected the finger print recognition to work like my previous iphones but alas it does not.
This replaced my generation 6 and what an improvement. It downloads very fast. Has a beautiful screen and the size is great.

Just upgraded to this iPad from my old 9.7-inch one and was thrilled that it would still be compatible with my 1st-gen Apple Pencil. Well, turns out you need Apple's special USB-C to lightning adapter that's specifically made for Apple Pencils in order to actually get the Pencil to pair; this detail is technically mentioned if you dig into the iPad product details a little, but it's not explicitly mentioned with the rest of the bold-text "compatible with Apple Pencil!!" declarations, so it's easy to miss. The off-brand USB-C/lightning adapters I bought still work for charging the iPad but not for pairing. So just be aware that if you want to be able to use your 1st-gen Pencil, you'll have to fork over another $10 for Apple's specific adapter. It works.Otherwise, the iPad itself is great. I love the larger screen, and the picture quality is fantastic. The process of transferring everything off my old iPad was easy. The battery life maybe isn't quite as good as I was hoping/expecting, especially if I'm streaming a lot of videos or working with large art files. But I'm excited to see what all I can use it for.
Cracked screen.  I love my iPad so sad the screen is cracked.

reviewTitle: elegance and sophistication, it is truly beautiful.
reviewDescription: The 10th generation Apple iPad is a masterpiece of modern technology, a perfect fusion of power, style and versatility. Since I started using it, it has revolutionized the way I work and connect.The first thing that blew me away was its stunning 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display. The images are so sharp and the colors so vibrant that every viewing is an experience in itself. Whether watching movies, editing photos or simply browsing the web, the quality of the screen makes every activity more enjoyable.At the heart of the iPad is the A14 Bionic chip, which delivers exceptional speed and performance. The efficiency of this chip is evident in everything I do, from effortless multitasking to the smooth operation of demanding apps and games. It's an incredibly powerful work tool that handles all my computing needs with ease.The Wi-Fi 6 connectivity is another outstanding feature, providing a fast and reliable internet connection. This is essential for my workflow and entertainment, ensuring I am always connected with the best possible speed.The 12MP cameras, both front and rear, are surprisingly good for a device in its class. Video conferencing is clearer and the photos I take are of great quality, making it a versatile tool for communication and content creation.The Security and convenience are guaranteed with Touch ID. It's fast, reliable and adds a hassle-free layer of protection. And, of course, the battery life is phenomenal. I can go all day using it without worrying about recharging it, which is a huge relief in my busy daily life.Lastly, the blue color design is simply beautiful. It's sleek, modern and stands out among other devices, adding a touch of personal style to my iPad experience.In summary, the 10th generation Apple iPad is an exceptional device that combines power, beauty and versatility. It's more than a tablet; it's a daily companion that enriches every aspect of my digital life.
Perfect for my sketching 💕 I love the pink color! The battery lasts forever and using it is so smooth.
This IPad, with all the latest updates, is wonderful. It is a great size of 10.9", lightweight, and exceptionally fast.

Received the iPad quickly and was easy to setup. It is replacing an 11 year old iPad dinosaur. And, the price was very good. The display is awesome and touch screen very responsive. 64 GB is plenty for my needs. It has both Touch ID and login pass code. The Touch ID works better than I expected. No facial recognition. Interesting that, to me, the volume bottoms are kind of reversed with the reduce volume on top and increase volume on the bottom. I've set up my news apps on the iPad for my morning coffee break. Much easier display than peering at the news on my iPhone 14. Glad I upgraded.

I recently purchased an iPad 10th gen and couldn't be happier! The user-friendly interface makes it a breeze to navigate, and the touchscreen controls are incredibly responsive. Setting it up was a seamless process, and the wide range of available apps enhances its versatility. The type c charger makes it more accessible as my household runs mostly on Samsung products. Overall, a fantastic purchase for its ease of use and enjoyable functionality!

I am an Apple fan and this is just another great product.  I like everything about it and it meets all of my expectations.  I got the blue one for something different and I also like the color.  The only thing I don't really understand is how Apple is mixing and matching the different generations of pencils with the different iPad types.  Seems like with the Gen 1, Gen 2 and USB they want to be sure that it isn't easy to switch iPads.  But I guess that is part of the marketing plan.

reviewTitle: Best iPad on a budget or if you are looking to upgrade!
reviewDescription: I had the iPad 7th generation iPad I really wanted to upgrade. Did I really upgrade! I love the 10th gen! I am still getting used to all the new features. I am actually writing this review on the keyboard. I feel sometimes that is is a laptop. I didn’t want to spend $100-200 on the Magic Keyboard in stead I spent around $20 same goes for the Apple Pencil I did not want to spend $115 on a pencil! This pencil was $15 it is my favorite color and also glittery! You just tap on the top of the pencil to connect it. The keyboard case comes off as well. I also got this iPad when it was on sale and man am I glad I waited!! I got the pink one so if you are thinking about getting a new iPad get this one on amazon I also gave my boyfriend my old iPad for school and he got a pen and keyboard case as well! LOVEEEEEEEEE just wish it came in purple but pink also works :) Thank you amazon

I bought the 10.9 inch Apple iPad because the 10.2 inch $249 iPad used the lightning connector. I already have a lot of USB-C stuff so my main reason for picking this device was to limit the number of connectors I had to keep track of.I chose yellow because it was the cheapest option (about $399 at the time I purchased it) but the metallic finish makes it appear more like gold to me. I am neither a color nor a precious metals expert, but if you told me the color of this iPad was supposed to be gold I would believe it (and I love it).Very pleased with the overnight shipping option. I ordered it fairly late last night and it arrived before noon the next morning.Ordered a $17 case that will be arriving tomorrow. This is my first brand-new tablet that I have ever owned (not including stuff like Kindles and other cheapy tablets I've tried that I all promptly returned because either their performance was not a good fit, it did not meet my needs or was riddled with involuntary ads). Previously I went with a used Samsung tablet back in 2015 that lasted for maybe 2 years before it became a brick and stopped turning on. I spent an hour on the phone with Samsung asking where to ship it to get it fixed. Samsung was not willing to repair it at all even though I was willing to pay for the repairs. I will never purchase another Samsung anything after that experience- they don't stand behind their own products.I've only owned this thing for a few minutes but I'm quite satisfied with it. I thought this package would include the Apple pencil, but alas, it did not.

Ok, so I bought this for the sake of digital drawing and editing my own drawings. I've only had this tablet for a short while but it's already leagues above previous tablets I've owned. I don't know much about Apple operating systems but once I had the tablet up and running and downloaded my favorite drawing apps such as Sketchbook this tablet impressed me so much. This is exactly what I was looking for regarding my art projects. So far very happy my purchase

reviewTitle: Great device for the cheapest price!
reviewDescription: Got this IPad 10th gen on sale for $349. Only 64gb’s. But I was fine with that. It is my first iPad in years. So figured why not. Amazon had the cheapest price anywhere. So scooped up the deal while I could.  Thing is fast, slim, and battery lasts SO LONG. Speakers are loud and sound is full. Screen isn’t fused to the digitizer like the Air model. But I can’t really tell!  So don’t let that deter you from this model!

reviewTitle: Ipad 10 generation issue and Seller solution.
reviewDescription: Pros:1. Visual pleasing to the eyes.2. Comes in different colors. Pink was my pick.3. Processor runs smoothly.4. Siri runs smoothly and fast.5. Folders allow apps to be organized.6. Apple pen 1 works excellent with the 10 generation.7. FaceTime crisp and clear.8. WiFi and Bluetooth connects quickly,9. Apple gives 3 months free trial on their tv and etc.Major Cons:1. Hardware issue with on and off button on the iPad gen 10. I did research after my IPad would not turn off. Research said it was a known hardware issue in Gen 10. However, Siri will turn off for you if you tell her.2. This company will not exchange the IPad, only accept returns minus the tax paid.My intake from interaction with this seller:The seller only offered a return, no exchange allowed.  Seller only gives back the computer cost and not the tax paid for iPad. Seller raised cost for pink iPad by 20 dollars on Amazon website. To send back and wait for refund  takes up to seven business days. Cost to send back and rebuy would cost would increase due to iPad color price increase, the loss of tax already paid, and the added new tax fee for new iPad. I added up the addition cost. It would be close to 100.00 for the same color and specs. So, the only choice I’m left with is to be stuck with the IPad unless I want to pay out around another 100.00 more after waiting for refund, then buy a new one, and wait for its delivery. That would put wait time about 1.5 weeks for a new computer to be delivered. That is a long wait when it is needed like yesterday.My only other solution:Contact Apple limited warranty to see if they will back up their Apple product and their solution.Lesson learned:Purchase iPad directly from Apple website. Cost is the same. Apple website offers an optional free engraving on their Ipad 10 generation.  The wait to receive Ipad is about a week.I hope my review will help others when deciding what is best for them and their decision on Ipad purchase.

Slippery device, placed device down on coffee table after removing from box, during set up device slipped from about 1-1.5 ft off ground onto carpet and screen cracked on several places.  A product this expensive should come with a protective case and glass from manufacturer.  Not optional aftermarket accessories.  Certainly optional aftermarket accessories for sale is fine, but Apple should provide a basic case or build the device to where so much as a sneeze and kiss several hundred $ away.  $50 fee if purchased apple care plan.  Very dissatisfied that electronic devices are now costing $1k and as fragile as a new born’s head.  Unacceptable that Apple essentially leaves consumers no choice but to purchase either Apple to Apple compatible devices and/or screen protectors, cases, and/or adapters for headphones or C-type charger.  Dislike the button for finger verification, not preferred over traditional button or facial recognition.  What’s the point of any of this if the product is made to break.  Hmmm seems dishonest and deceitful.  Apple cannot hide behind there stance on sleek design to circumvent strong durable materials that adequately protect device.  Everyone knows it is always wise to have extra protection on their devices as most likely at some point you dropped your device prior to.  I always get the strongest otter box or military grade cases.  But that’s because I know I’m going to drop my phone it’s just a matter of time

reviewTitle: Beware- restocking fee charged when defective item sold
reviewDescription: I purchased an iPad from this seller and less than 2 weeks the iPad stopped working. It's the black screen of death from my understanding. The iPad is on but completely black. When I plug in the charger I hear the connection sound so I know it's on but the screen will not turn on. I took videos of it. I've notified the seller of this issue but no response at all to my message but instead approved my return but did not message or notify me of the restocking fee. 2 weeks after I sent in my return I finally get a refund but minus $86 of restocking fee!! I had to reach out to Amazon for this issue and that is when Amazon notified me of the restocking fee. Amazon was not able to refund me to my original payment but offered an Amazon credit which I appreciate. But I am still very dissatisfied with the seller.After my return was approved, I went ahead and ordered another iPad with the same seller. If I knew this seller charges restocking fee on defective items, I would not have purchased another iPad from them. I definitely will not be purchasing another item from them with how unprofessional they are.

I bought this for my daughter to use, but it is impossible to set up for a child with parental controls unless you also have another Apple product. I can't load or install any apps for her to use, because they must be approved by an adult, but those approvals MUST come from an Apple device, not Android, Microsoft, or even web-based portals are allowed. This effectively means that my daughter cannot download any apps unless I give her unrestricted use of my credit card. Haha, no.I will never buy another Apple product as long as I live.

reviewTitle: Doesn't work and unable to return
reviewDescription: Unless you are an expert in Apple products, I recommend not buying this from Amazon.  This product is difficult to set up.  Support from Amazon referred us to Apple support which was unable to help us.  I tried to return it and it was within the return window but the system would not allow me to return it.  I can find no way to talk to a real person about this issue.  Took it to an Apple store and was told that if we had purchased it from them, they would have set it up for us.  So, if you want this product and are not an expert at Apple products, buy it from an Apple store.  Now we are stuck with a tablet that doesn't work!

Ordered this ipad to replace an existing one and memory was way too small, only slightly bigger than the operating system.  Returning for one with more storage.Amazon return required to take to a limited location, 40 minute drive from my house.  When we arrived at 9am (when they opened) there was a line of people waiting for the return office to open.  After 30m minutes of waiting, I needed to leave.  Big waste of time and the package still hasn’t been delivered. So much for Prime service and easy returns.

A week after they delivered it and it no longer charges or turns on. I already followed the “instructions” in the seller's videos to restart or try to turn it on and it doesn't work. I tried to chat with customer service and there is no availability! This is frustating ! I just need to return it.

I just purchased this one year ago and now it won’t charge. I have followed all the trouble shooting recommendations and still doesn’t charge. I took good care of it.  It is so upsetting as I expected it to work for longer than a year.

reviewTitle: MAKE SURE IT IS NOT FROM A THIRD PARTY SELLER
reviewDescription: Apple only guarantees authentic products from AMAZON. I purchased two iPads from the Amazon Apple store front and this one shipped via a third party. I immediately called Apple to ask and was told it has to be sold by Amazon, if you contact the seller ask if they can show they’re authorized Apple resellers, otherwise you don’t know what you’re getting.

Really wish I would have looked at the reviews before purchasing.  It really is an ugly gold color not the light yellow shown in the picture.  Very disappointed since yellow is my favorite color and I was so excited for this.

reviewTitle: It worked GREAT, until it didn't.
reviewDescription: I purchased this iPad on August 10, 2023. I am studying Radiography and am required to have an iPad with the HanDBase application for clinical tracking. If I don't have an iPad with the HanDBase app when I show up for clinical rotations I will be sent home and receive an absence. This is not good - anyone in school for the medical field will say that these programs are strict. So, I did the responsible thing and purchased a NEW, 10th GEN iPad. And it has been great for almost six months. Today I noticed it didn't charge when I plugged it in. I tried other outlets and other charge cords/blocks to no avail. I did all the troubleshooting - restart, hard restart, reset the entire device. It IS covered under a basic one-year warranty so I've made an appointment to get it fixed on Monday - but I have no idea how long the repair will take and need it by Thursday at 8 am. I'm so disappointed and frustrated. I've kept it in a case, and never let it get anywhere near moisture; I've always taken good care of it and this is unacceptable - a product like this should last longer than six months. What are my options now? Buy ANOTHER iPad? Ridiculous. Get an unexcused absence because of a faulty charging port? More ridiculous.

After 1 week of having this iPad , it’s a struggle to charge … It’s like the iPad itself has a shortage? I’ve used different chargers & the issue persists! I’ve used my charger on other iPads & no problem, they charge just fine.
The hertz rating is really low so you will notice blurring when you scroll. The front facing camera is terrible. Just get an iPad Pro.

It's good Apple tablet but they ask more than 400$ for this while there is no face id, headphones port and USB-C headphones connector is a disgrace.  The price for this device should be way smaller due to missing key features.

reviewTitle: little difference to older versions and design flaws
reviewDescription: Why, anywhere, if apple has the tech to make bluetooth pencils, would they not and make a machine which took three steps back to have you plug it in.I had an older pro, that works as fast and the same as this "new technology" and at the least h pencil clipped to the side of it magnetically, and charged via bluetooth.I am trading it in.
I bought this iPad thinking it’ll be yellow but it was gold and looked ugly to me but fast shipping and easy returns!

Was all excited for a tablet, but I end up having to use my 5 year old a6ndroid phone to get on the same wifi bc it connects more reliably than this brand new iPad. Incredibly disappointed. Spent hours with support, on the phone & at geek squad, reinstalling the OS & other hopefully fixes. Finally gave up on that & their 2 week return window was over. Not sure if they're all this bad or I got a lemon. So much for Apple being more user friendly.It's good when it works, but I spend WAY too much time watching the loading wheel spin. I switch to my phone all the time. Super frustrating.
In most instances, I have to touch the screen several times for it to respond. Annoying and time consuming.

The 10th generation ipad is nothing to write home about. And there is a design issue right out of the gate. I set up three Mail accounts, and none of them show folders (i.e., mailboxes). You can move a message/email to a folder (and see the folders in the Move subwindow), but you cannot see or access the folders (or mailboxes) in any of the  Mail accounts. This appears to be a design flaw, as Apple support cannot address, and none of the support forums can fix. While I’m on the subject of Apple bugs, Apple has been problematic for years now. My last ipad had a defective battery (overheated and went to black screen, even after factory reset) in less than 2 years. I nicknamed the MacBook Air the “crashy trashy MacBook Air” because it crashes if you attempt to do any serious work on it in Excel or Creative Suite. They’re making playthings for kids, and all their products are overpriced. The design is not intuitive, and they haven’t put out a great product for years.

reviewTitle: Cheap quality iPad with two major flaws: very poor audio quality and no anti reflective feature
reviewDescription: I wanted a new iPad in the medium size and chose this one (10th gen 64GB) for almost 500 dollars including tax from Apple. After using it for three days, this one felt more like a $100 ipad. It is unbelievable that Apple is selling such cheap quality iPads after all the years it has been iterating them. It is surprising that so many of the reviews here failed to mention two major flaws in this iPad . First, the audio quality is the poorest I have seen in a mobile device. It is muffled and tinny and unclear. So, I went to the local Apple Store and a worker there let me test the different models. This model had the same poor quality as my copy at home, however, the iPad Air 5th gen seemed better in quality as it did not sound muffled and tinny. Why was this model of iPad fitted with such cheap speakers??? This is unbelievable and unexpected for a 500 dollar iPad.. This is by far the biggest flaw in this iPad model. The other major flaw is the screen on this model is reflective to the point of being annoying while Air has the anti reflective feature that helps a bit. Both Issues are deal breakers for me, just by themselves let alone together, esp the audio. Needless to say I am returning this iPad 10 model as I am within the two week window.Please evaluate the audio and all the features of this model iPad at a store before you buy it. If you use Bluetooth audio devices the poor speakers will not impact you, but most people frequently use the iPad audio directly.The video quality and weight are alright and I do not mind the lack of Face ID, but the above mentioned deal breakers shut down this model for me. No thank you. I may go with iPad Air 5th gen after testing it more. I will not use this iPad even if Apple gave it to me for free.

First, I did not buy my 10th gen iPad through Amazon, but directly through Apple. I did, however, buy a pleather folio case (Ztotop) for this iPad from Amazon and it is excellent.I've had a 7th gen iPad for a number of years and wanted to upgrade to the larger screen and more powerful processor. I use my iPad largely for web browsing and viewing Excel docs created on my PC, saved to OneDrive and viewed on the iPad with a free Microsoft Excel viewing app. Here are my Con's and Pro's.Con'sThe larger screen doesn't seem much larger. It's is brighter and a bit more crisp, but the larger screen doesn't show more or make it any easier to read.The intuitive home button is gone. I know they removed it to save money and create space for the larger screen, but it had real value.Replacing the home button is a series of bizarre swipes and motions that make little sense and are diffcult to master. I suspect this part of the U/I was designed by a very junior engineer who never used an earlier generation of iPad.The On/Off button is a total mess. If the iPad is on, pressing the button turns off the screen but does not turn off the device. To turn if off you have to hold down the button with one finger and hold down the volume button for a precise fraction of a second, or else it captures a screen shot. Who thought this was a good solution?And I save the worst for last: Microsoft's free Excel viewer does not run on this iPad. Not at all. Microsoft decided that devices with larger screens can't run the free app, so to view Excel spreadsheets (and other Office docs, I assume) you MUST subscribe to Office 365. I don't want or need to manipulate spreadsheets on a handheld device but Microsoft imposes a $72 per year tax just to view them. Microsoft has the right to choose where their software runs, but Apple and/or Microsoft should have published a notification that the old app is dead meat on the new iPad.Pro'sIt charges very quickly.Performance is crisp, although for me not appreciably better than the 7th gen.As with other Apple devices, transferring content and settings from the old iPad was simple and reasonably fast.SummaryIf I could do it again I would not buy this device and continued to roll with my gen 7 iPad.

reviewTitle: Great design, less than great execution
reviewDescription: My third iPad in 10 years - the last  one has lasted 7 years and is still working.  This latest iPad, 10th generation/2002 model, has a lot going for it:  a large, excellent display, a fast chip, good storage (256 gb), good sound, and very good battery life.  My prob has been internet connectivity, which has been episodic.  Thanks to Apple Care support, which is predicatably very good, I was able to backup my data and apps, restore factory settings, and reload my apps and data.  So far, all's well.  But beware that this new iPad has quality issues that may be more widespread than just my experience.Update after two months:  Reloading software, data and apps did not resolve this connectivity issue.  By trial and error I discovered that my ISP’s 5g network protocol doesn’t work well with this iPad.  Interestingly, I don’t have this prob with my older iPhone and Mac, which work well with 5g.  When I adjusted the network setting back to the slower 4g setting, which Apple Care didn’t suggest, the connectivity issue disappeared.  But 4g is still fast enough for video streaming and other routine tasks, so I’m satisfied - just not thrilled with how long it took to come up with a workable solution.
Love everything about it

It’s over all good. Definitely opened probs used but I mean it works and looks like new so not complaining plus price was good. Definitely a good option would probably just buy a new one next time but overall good

reviewTitle: Amazing step up from our old iPad.
reviewDescription: The Apple iPad (10th Generation): with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 64GB, Wi-Fi I bought is such a huge step up from the last iPad we had. Screen response is fast, app load quick and the battery stays charged all day without issues even when watching/streaming video. I went with the blue and it looks really nice.Step up was so easy using my iPhone and it came with the outlet plug and cable to charge it. What I really love is it comes with USB-C instead of the lightning cable. I hated the lightning cable as they always seemed to stop working and on some of our iPads for the kids they don't plug in properly and you have to do some crazy warping of the cable to get it to connect and charge. After about 9 months of using this iPad 10th gen I haven't had any charging or cable issues. So happy about that.The first thing I recommend no matter if you're an adult or it is a gift for a child is getting a screen protector and case put on from day one. It will save you so much anguish if anything happens like a cat knocking it off the coffee table for instance haha.The performance and display are breathtaking when coming from an older generation and the camera is so much better. I've used mine for work, vacationing and giving the kids something to do. We got it on sale, super happy with this Apple iPad 10th gen and would definitely buy again.

reviewTitle: iPad 10 256g Is Expensive Even On Sale
reviewDescription: I upgraded from an iPad 7 w/32g because I ran out of storage space. Apple is very stingy when it comes to iPad storage. This time I bought the iPad 10 with 256g of storage. It was expensive even on sale. Other than that these are great devices. The iPad 10 has a fast A14 Bionic processor, a bigger screen than previous iPads, more storage, plus Apple got rid of the Home Button which allows for a larger display area. The iPad 10 on sale cost the same as an iPad Air w/64g of storage. But I needed larger storage of the iPad 10.

The new iPad with 128gb WiFi and no cellular service plan. Blue case. It’s great. But I’m comparing it to a 1st gen Air that the battery finally would not stay charged for more than a few days. There is one thing I do not like, turning the iPad off.The only sure way is going to settings and using  shutdown.Other software changes are confusing at first yet not a big problem. Like it populated the flip screens from right to left, yet starts up on the far left screen??  So all my most used icons are on the very last screen to the right…It’s the same size as my AIR. Camera is in central location rather than on the side. Keyboard interface is such that I can use my previous keyboard and holder/case if I don’t want to use outward looking camera. Touch ID is nice. And of course backup, iCloud, device interconnection is great with Apple.

Right now, it is a confusing hodge podge of iPads.  Always look for at least one hundred dollars off the price of the iPad before purchasing, otherwise you are paying too much. This iPad is such a bad experience if you want to use the Apple Pencil.This iPad only works with Apple Pencil Gen 1 and requires a special USB-C to Lightning adapter in order to make it work. If you turn off the iPad or Bluetooth for ANY reason, you can't use the Apple Pencil again until you hook it up to the iPad with the adapter and USB-C cord. Every. Single. Time.Literally the $20 knock off pencils work better because they don't require Bluetooth pairing to work. The only thing they can't do is pressure sensitivity.I don't understand WHAT Apple was thinking when it came to deciding that a USB-C based iPad should only work with a Lightning based Pencil. It's such a poor design and poor planning on their part for such an expensive device (which is, ironically, their "budget" device). And very unfortunate if you're out for the day and didn't think you'd need to carry both your USB-C cable *and* Pencil adapter just to make the two talk to each other again.If you plan to use the Apple Pencil and not a dupe, maybe look for a different iPad model. An older iPad that still uses Lightning technology will work great with the original Pencil. Far better than this.

reviewTitle: I love iPhones & iPads but this iPad has some technical issues
reviewDescription: I think I got a lemon. I have loved iPhone & iPad products for many years but this iPad has some issues. Some apps, when I rotate the screen, freezes up the iPad and I have to close the screen. When I try to unlock the iPad to reopen and restart the app, nothing happens! No Lock Screen shows up, nothing at all happens when I push the power button. This sometimes lasts several minutes before a Lock Screen appears so I can open/unlock the iPad. Really frustrating! Otherwise this iPad works pretty well.

Needed a new iPad because the old one had a scratched screen and ran ever so slowly. This iPad is nice looking and has a longer battery life but not the all day as advertised. I had a few glitches transferring the info from old to new but overall I really like this iPad.

This is my first iPad so I only have android tablets to compare. Uses battery very quickly, it is worse with using Bluetooth. I lost original cord and new cord charges extremely slow like 10% after 30 minutes charging. I like the programs and love using it but charged and battery life is frustrating. I don’t like using blue tooth headphones but there is no headphone Jack for regular headphones.
